isis.stitle: 8 SPEED, 9 SPEED, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON SERIES - AIR SYSTEM - ROADRANGER VALVE A-4900

figure.caption: Figure 17. Roadranger Valve A-4900 Exploded View

step1.para: Remove the two screws holding the bottom cover to the valve and slide the cover down the gear shift lever to expose the air line fittings. Disconnect air lines.
Loosen the jam nut and turn the control valve from the gear shift lever.
Pry the medallion from the recess in the top cover.
Remove the two screws and the top cover from valve housing.
Remove the actuator button from the valve housing and the spring retainer, springs, seal and detent parts from the actuator and/or valve housing.
Remove the two screws on the side of the valve housing to separate the housing.
Remove the Range Preselection Lever from the left housing and the position balls and guide from the lever.
If necessary, remove the spring and O-ring from the bores in the left housing.
If necessary, remove the springs, O-ring and retainer from the bores in the right housing.

Refer to Figure 17 for proper reassembly. Use a VERY SMALL amount of silicone lubricant on the O-rings to avoid clogging ports. A small amount of grease on the position springs and balls will help to hold them in place during reassembly.
Re-install the control valve on the gear shift lever and tighten the jam nut.
Attach the air lines and re-install the bottom cover.
